ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - ABM Greiffenberger welcomes nine new trainees home | suchen | impressum | downloads | Branchen | Produkte | Kleinserien | Service | Unternehmen | Karriere | Kontakt | home > home > news > abm greiffenberger welcomes nine new trainees The motor behind our success Jobs with future ABM Greiffenberger welcomes nine new trainees Today, nine new trainees start their apprenticeship or dual degree program at ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH Marktredwitz. So the training year 2014/15, the company employs total of 29 trainees. Five of them are young women who have decided to learn technical occupation. “ We place great importance on motivated and qualified specialists from our own ranks – they are the motor behind our success “, says Robert Lackermeier, Managing Director at ABM Greiffenberger. “ Therefore, we are sustainably promoting new blood for our own requirements – e.g. with diversified working environment modern training workshop, own ABM Academy and last but not least with extensive preparations for the exams .“ Candidates for 2015 are now welcome to apply ABM Greiffenberger offers training for the following occupational areas: electronic engineer for machines and drive technology, mechatronic engineer, the dual degree program industrial engineering / mechatronics, tool and metal-cutting mechanics. Also for 2015 can already be applied. For more information, please visit the career portal on our website at: www.abm-drives.com Left to right: Dominik Sagolla (Youth Representative), Ottmar Wiche (Deputy Chairman of the Works Council), Yannik Mueller, Christoph Moeller, Patrick Wegmann, Jeremia Frenzel, Johannes Herrmann, Jessica Dirks, Niclas Dollinger, David Wood, Johannes Zinnecker, Susanne Strauß (Personnel Management), Hermann Ransberger (Chairman of the Works Council), Bernhard Wenning (Training Manager) Diese Seite drucken Anfrage Seite stellen

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - LogiMAT 2015 home | suchen | impressum | downloads | Branchen | Produkte | Kleinserien | Service | Unternehmen | Karriere | Kontakt | home > home > news > logimat 2015 ABM presents efficient drive technology ABM Greiffenberger with efficient drive technology at the LogiMAT 2015 At the LogiMAT (Stuttgart, 10th to 12th February 2015) hall 1, booth 1A31, ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH presents excerpt of the company’s extensive portfolio from the areas storage techniques, forklift trucks and e-mobility. Among other things, new controller for the storage sector be on display. It is versatile and enhances the processes the container conveyor technology. For the time being, the new controller has been designed for motor power of 0.75 kW and works without any problem at temperatures from -30° up to +50°C. The sensorless control has been perfectly adjusted to the ABM Sinochron motors. Pluggable connections can easily be reached from outside and several drives can be operated from one power supply. Users adjust the necessary parameters by means of Near Field Communication (NFC) via PC or Smartphone-App. The service-friendly controller has been designed for the direct assembly to the motor. Alternatively, it can be attached to the wall, separated from the motor. Its very compact design with aluminium die-cast housing allows easy, quick installation. The ABM innovation can be used many intra-logistics applications of the container conveyor technology roller conveyors, belt conveyors or curved conveyors. The new controller of ABM Greiffenberger is suitable for many applications the container conveyor technology Energy-efficient SINOCHRON®Motors In the area of storage logistics, ABM Greiffenberger shows energy-efficient SINOCHRON® motors as compact drive units for roller conveyors. They work with high process reliability at temperatures of -30° up to +45°C and are therefore suited for the use deep-freeze rooms. SINOCHRON® motors reach highest efficiencies the part-load operational range and are that way lowering the energy costs. The drive unit without gearbox provides top plant availability. It moves mobile loads of up to 180 kilogram and reaches conveying velocities of 0.3 up to 1.2 m/s. SINOCHRON® Motors of ABM reach the highest efficiency the part-load operational range and are saving energy that way Maintenance-free and easy to install angular gear units Two-stage angular gear units of the KG-series of ABM with nominal torques of up to 700 Nm be on display. They are maintenance-free and easy to mount because of their angular design. The gearboxes are available two executions, full shaft and hollow shaft. They are suited for the assembly to asynchronous or Sinochron motors. The KG-series, made of aluminium die-cast (Al 230), has smooth, dirt-repellent surface and convinces with high corrosion resistance. The shaft-mounted helical gear units of the FGA-series of ABM have been designed for output of 50 to 2,300 Nm. The two-, three- and four-stage gear units only need little space due to their compact design and offer significant advantages for the assembly with their large shaft centre distance. Top-quality toothing makes them low-noise and durable. Apart from corrosion resistance, the aluminium motor and gearbox housings offer considerable advantages for the assembly due to their little weight. Compact drives for electric vehicles The SINOCHRON® drives for auxiliary units, which ABM presents the area of e-mobility, are energy-efficient, durable and compact. The motors have sensorless control, are compact and cost-efficient. Electronic controllers, which have been optimized for the special application, considerably reduce losses the entire use and thus increase the energy efficiency of the system. ABM offers travel drives like the 22 / 45 kW motor for smaller electric vehicles as well. The maximum torque of 130 Nm establishes the pre-condition for dynamic accelerating and high driving pleasure. The large field weakening range of the motors allows high climbing ability and fast driving without manual transmission. Thanks to high power spectrum and efficient air cooling, this drive reaches efficiencies of up to 93%. The SINOCHRON® Motors developed by ABM Greiffenberger are perfectly suited to serve as energy-saving drive of auxiliary units utility vehicles Bevel gear units with high torque For the industrial sector of forklift trucks, ABM shows bevel gear units of the series TDB 254. With their high torque transmission capacity, quiet running and longevity, they are particularly suited for mobile applications such as forklift trucks and commissioners. The encoder feedback developed by ABM is new. It is cost-efficient alternative to concepts with potentiometer. The encoder feedback is integrated into the intermediate flange. The encoder itself is easily accessible from the top case it needs servicing. This prevents soiling as it can happen hitherto existing solutions with encoders next to the driving wheel. The ABM novelty can be used flexibly with different sensors. As system supplier the forklift truck sector, ABM Greiffenberger offers complete, precisely matched and highly efficient drive systems including travel and steering motor. The ABM bevel gear units of the series TDB 254 have now been furnished with cost-efficient encoder feedback The wheel hub drive of the series TDH 280 of ABM presented Stuttgart is suitable for the use cleaning machines and transport systems damp surroundings. It is maintenance-free, robust and designed as complete unity of motor, brake and gearbox. It is supplied with battery voltage of 36 Volt and does 1.2 kW. Its compact design allows small installation heights and makes the installation into the vehicle easy. For the use counterbalanced trucks up to load of 2.0 t, ABM has developed the steering unit SDH as three-stage helical gearbox with mounted AC-motor. The battery voltage is 48 Volt, the output 0.9 kW. The geared unit as complete motor-gearbox-unit has been designed for high load demands and can easily be mounted forklift trucks. The ABM development is cost-optimized design and convinces with efficiency of 94%. ABM Greiffenberger at the LogiMAT: Hall 1, booth 1A31 Diese Seite drucken Anfrage Seite stellen

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - Donations instead of gifts home | suchen | impressum | downloads | Branchen | Produkte | Kleinserien | Service | Unternehmen | Karriere | Kontakt | home > home > news > donations instead of gifts ABM Greiffenberger shows its social commitment Donations instead of gifts ABM Greiffenberger shows its social commitment again ABM Greiffenberger is well aware of its social responsibility for the region and gives its support where help is really needed. For the sixth time row now, ABM Greiffenberger supported different projects and organizations instead of sending the usual tokens of appreciation to customers and business partners at Christmas. At the end of last year, the following organizations received donation already: Glücksmomente e.V., Achern: With our donation, 10 mentally and physically handicapped children from the district of Wunsiedel can attend riding therapy sessions for month. Kinderhilfe Eckental GmbH, Eckental: The clinic Fichtelgebirge Marktredwitz received 25 consolation teddies. They divert the little patients and accompany the children to check-ups and treatments. Tagesmütter Landkreis Wunsiedel e.V.: With this support, the rooms of the multigenerational house „Die Strolche“ be furnished further. Moreover, 3.000 € were donated from the proceeds of raffle „ It is important that socially committed companies do not shut their eyes to problems. We want to contribute to the well-being of the people our region and therefore, we are very happy to support two more organizations with donation from the proceeds of our Christmas party raffle. While doing this, it is very important for us to know that 100% of our support reaches those people who need it most. “, explains Robert Lackermeier, CEO at ABM Greiffenberger. One part of the proceeds goes to the Kinder- Jugendhilfezentrum St. Josef Wunsiedel. Joachim Lehmann, head of the Kinder- Jugendhilfezentrums St. Josef expressed his thanks for the generous donation. „ With it, ABM Greiffenberger gives us opportunity for activities and actions, projects and acquisitions that can otherwise only rarely be financed .“ Moreover, the Kinder- Jugendhilfezentrum St. Josef received the first prize of the raffle. Wolfgang Benzing, sector manager for e-mobility at ABM Greiffenberger, had won this first prize – table football table. He forwarded it to St. Josef with the words: „ I hope, the children and young people have lot of fun with it .“ The second part of the proceeds is used to support the newly founded social counselling for asylum seekers that called into being by the circle of supporters for refugees Arzberg at the beginning of this year. Alexander Wagner (AWO Arzberg) and Guenther Beyer accepted the cheque on behalf of the circle of supporters for refugees that consists of 20 people from totally different sectors of society. Both expressed their heartfelt thanks the name of the asylum seekers. With the earmarked donation, language courses for the refugees staying shared accommodation be made possible. Learning the German language helps them to overcome language barriers and thus become faster integrated our country. Handing over of the cheque to the Kinder- Jugendhilfezentrum St. Josef and the Flüchtlingshilfe Arzberg: F.l.t.r.: Ann-Katrin Eiser (Division management Kinder- Jugendhilfezentrum St. Josef), Joachim Lehmann (Head of the Kinder- Jugendhilfezentrum St. Josef), Robert Lackermeier (CEO of ABM Greiffenberger), Alexander Wagner (AWO Arzberg), Guenther Beyer (Circle of Supporters for Refugees) and Hermann Ransberger (Chairman of the works council at ABM Greiffenberger) Diese Seite drucken Anfrage Seite stellen

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - Powerful & Durable home | suchen | impressum | downloads | Branchen | Produkte | Kleinserien | Service | Unternehmen | Karriere | Kontakt | home > home > news > powerful & durable Energy efficient drives for electric vehicles ABM Greiffenberger Energy efficient drives for electric vehicles For decades, ABM Greiffenberger has been one of the world leading manufacturers of electric drive unit systems for battery powered vehicles. The company, located the Bavarian town Marktredwitz, offers efficient system solutions from single source for high performance with low energy use. At the LogiMAT Stuttgart, ABM presents among other things the drive motor 45 kW. This motor increases the performance of electric vehicles considerably. Manufacturers of electric vehicles need well thought-out drive technology with best performance. In addition to economical driving techniques and good aerodynamics, order to travel long distances, first and foremost efficient drive components are required. Electric vehicles must reach the permissible speeds town as well as on urban motorways and country roads. In its AC-motor portfolio, ABM offers suitable solutions up to 45kW for light electric vehicles of the classes L7e and M1 with formally not restricted speed. The maximum torque of 130 Nm of the 45kW drive motor creates the precondition for dynamic accelerating and high driving pleasure. The lightweight construction with weight of only 43 kilogram fulfills the high demands on vehicle weight and payload. The large field weakening range of the motor allows high climbing ability and fast driving without manual transmission. Thanks to high power density and efficient air cooling, this drive reaches efficiency of up to 93 %. The motor reaches maximum speed of 8,000 rpm. The 45 kW motor of ABM Greiffenberger with maximum torque of 130 Nm ensures dynamic acceleration. In Stuttgart, ABM shows energy efficient Sinochron motors for auxiliary units and attachments as they are used commercial vehicles, busses, agricultural machinery and construction machines, but the area of material handling. The drive is permanently energized synchronous motor with high efficiency, great power density and compact dimensions. The special design of the rotor with built-in magnets leads to almost ideal sinusoidal distribution of the magnetic flux. Therefore, Sinochron motors are especially well suited for sensorless controlled operation. That way, they are economic alternative to expensive servo drives. As there is no external magnetization, there are no losses the rotor through magnetizing currents. Therefore, Sinochron motors of ABM Greiffenberger reach constantly high efficiency almost the complete speed range. The rotor’s design is simple and robust. The complete sensor technology for speed measurement and position detection with its connectors can be left out. This ensures very high reliability and availability. Sinochron motors are predestined for all applications with constant torque the complete speed range and heavily fluctuating loads. In Stuttgart, ABM presents energy efficient Sinochron motors for auxiliary units and attachments High competence as system supplier ABM Greiffenberger offers gearboxes, motors, brakes and drive controls from single source and has high competence as system supplier for customer-specific solutions. Problematic steps between various suppliers are thus avoided. The established competence of the company stretches over all processes: from the in-house construction of tools and fixtures and aluminium-casting foundry, CNC-machining of the housings to the manufacturing of shafts and cutting of gear teeth, from the motor winding technology to the assembly and final testing of the products. In addition to intensive research and development work, ABM Greiffenberger attaches great importance to reliable production. The company uses the latest technology like laser-assisted measurement systems. Endurance tests and 100% checks round off this package of measures. This thorough network of testing ensures the high reliability of the ABM products. Diese Seite drucken Anfrage Seite stellen

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - Powerful drives for industrial trucks home | suchen | impressum | downloads | Branchen | Produkte | Kleinserien | Service | Unternehmen | Karriere | Kontakt | home > home > news > powerful drives for industrial trucks System Integration Material Handling Powerful drives for industrial trucks System Integration Material Handling As system supplier for drives of the material handling technology, ABM offers complete, precisely matched and highly efficient drive systems for industrial trucks. At the LogiMAT Stuttgart, the company – located the Bavarian town Marktredwitz – presents among other things powerful ABM bevel gear units of the series TDB 254 for the system integration. The cost-saving encoder feedback is new the program. Bevel gear units of the series TDB 254 distinguish themselves through their high torque transmission capacity, very quiet running and long service life. The encoder feedback, newly developed by ABM, is cost-effective alternative to concepts with potentiometers and is integrated into the intermediate flange. This prevents soiling as it can happen hitherto existing solutions with encoders next to the driving wheel. For the user, ABM’s solution is easily accessible from the top case it needs servicing. Moreover, it can be used flexibly with different sensors. The bevel gear units of the series TDB 254 excel with very quiet running and have been furnished with encoder feedback. The series TDB 254 is highly efficient and is used large number of industrial trucks. Vehicle developers can now respond even better to customer-specific requirements and have the choice either to use smaller, more cost-effective batteries for the same operating time or to design the vehicles for longer operating times until the next charging process. The complete gear design has been tailored to the mobile use and is especially robust. The unit works with high process reliability even rough environmental conditions and at temperatures of down to minus 40°C. The quiet running of the drives increases the driving comfort. The efficient dynamics improves the productivity of the vehicles practice. The bevel gear units TDB 254 are being used different mobile machines. The range reaches from hand pallet trucks and commissioners, reach trucks and tractors to driverless transport systems (FTS). Outside the material handling technology, the ABM solution aims at applications like cleaning machines and working platforms. ABM Greiffenberger presents another system solution: the wheel hub drive of the series TDH 280. It is especially suited for the use cleaning vehicles like sweepers and sweep-vacuum vehicles. The drive with wheel diameter of 280 millimetres works reliably transport systems that are being used damp surroundings. ABM offers the wheel hub drive as three-stage helical/planetary gear unit with integrated AC-motor, holding brake, speed- and thermosensor. The designing engineers attach great importance to serviceability: TDH 280 is completely maintenance-free. Its robust design masters even difficult tasks rough production surroundings without any problems. The drive is supplied with battery voltage of 36 Volt and does 1.2 kW. The ABM innovation has compact design with small envelope circle. Its small height makes the installation easy. The concept of this wheel hub can easily be integrated different types of vehicles and is especially suited for concepts with low platform height through its small installation height. The wheel hub drive of the series TDH 280 is especially well suited for the use cleaning machines. For the use 3-wheel counterbalanced trucks with load of up to two tons, ABM presents the steering unit SDH. It works as three-stage helical gearbox with mounted AC-motor. The battery voltage is 48 Volt, the output 0.9 kW. The component has been designed as complete motor-gearbox-sensor-unit. This steering unit is extremely service-friendly, maintenance work is not necessary. With the series SDH, the system supplier offers the users cost-optimized steering concept. The gear unit has efficiency of 94%. Through its compact design, the steering unit SDH can easily be mounted lift trucks and it has proved its robust design many times practice at high load demands. Steering unit SDH for the use counterbalanced trucks with load of up to two tons. 20 years experience material handling For 20 years now, ABM Greiffenberger has been manufacturing AC-drives for material handling applications and can bank on comprehensive know-how as system supplier for the industrial truck industry. More than 2 million drives have been integrated into the applications of the material handling area up until today. The drive specialist works closely together with the customer all the way from the development phase to the series production and offers the best possible solutions from single source for the respective applications the areas driving, lifting or steering. The system solutions of ABM excel with their high output at low energy consumption and little maintenance work. They guarantee long service life and process reliability, have compact design and can be integrated into machines with very little development effort. The use of the newest gearbox and motor technology is proof of the high environmental awareness of the company. Drive solutions of ABM – from the extensive construction kit system or customized – are convincing through their exemplary energy efficiency. Diese Seite drucken Anfrage Seite stellen

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - Systems Solution home | suchen | impressum | downloads | Branchen | Produkte | Kleinserien | Service | Unternehmen | Karriere | Kontakt | home > home > news > systems solution Controller improves processes warehouse logistics Systems Solution New controller improves processes warehouse logistics At the LogiMAT Stuttgart, ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH presents new controller for intralogistics. It is highly versatile and improves processes the container conveyor technology. It shows its strengths especially combination with energy-efficient gear units and motors of ABM Greiffenberger. For the time being, the new controller has been designed for motor power of up to 0.75 kW and works with asynchronous motors as well as permanently excited motors at temperature range of -30° up to +50°C without any problems. The ABM Sinochron Motors can be operated sensorless without encoder feedback and they are extremely reliable. In practice, they are distinguished by high efficiencies, high power density and compact dimensions. The new controller of ABM Greiffenberger is suitable for many applications the container conveyor technology. Users can install the controller and put it into operation very easily. Pluggable connections ensure the easy and process-reliable installation. Preassembled cables can be connected without any special tools. An NFC interface ensures the quick start of operations of the BUS-compatible controllers. Users adjust the necessary parameters according to the operating conditions simply by means of Near Field Communication (NFC) via PC or Smartphone-App. The decentralized controller has been designed for the direct assembly to the motor. Alternatively, it can be attached to the wall, separated from the motor. Moreover, several drives can be operated from one common power supply (Daisy Chain). The aluminium die-cast housing is light but robust. It can be used without any problems even harsh environmental conditions. The ABM novelty can be flexibly used many intralogistics applications of the container conveyor technology e.g. roller conveyors, belt conveyors or curved conveyors. In warehouse logistics, quick and process-reliable handling of goods is necessary order to fulfill the customers‘ requirements for prompt supply. Therefore, especially the conveyor technology must show the highest equipment availability. The roller, belt and curved conveyors which are mainly used are being combined depending on the specific plant. It is advantageous to use angular gear drive as necessary drive unit as it can be space-savingly installed to the conveyor technology then. For this case, ABM Greiffenberger offers system solutions as e.g. the angular gear KG62 connection with the SINOCHRON® Motor and mounted controller. The drive combinations are highly versatile and offer efficient solutions for quick and reliable handling of goods. Diese Seite drucken Anfrage Seite stellen

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - ABM Greiffenberger: home | suchen | impressum | downloads | Branchen | Produkte | Kleinserien | Service | Unternehmen | Karriere | Kontakt | home > home > news > abm greiffenberger: Customer and Sector Orientation ABM Greiffenberger: Consistently continue along the path of absolute customer and sector orientation ABM Greiffenberger is among the leading international system suppliers of upmarket, efficient drive solutions for machines, installations and mobile devices. In the interview, the Managing Director, Mr. Robert Lackermeier and the new ABM-Sales Manager, Mr. Peter Dittmers examine current developments and challenges of the sector. Optimal flexibility and strict customer orientation are the top topics. ABM is present many sectors with drive solutions. What are the advantages of the company? Robert Lackermeier: „ABM Greiffenberger pays greatest attention to optimal flexibility order to be able to react quickly and accurately to the customers‘ wishes. The development of powerful customized drive solutions is one of our key strengths. Our modularly structured, diversified product range enables us to offer perfectly adjusted solutions. We are fulfilling high rate of on-time deliveries order to satisfy our customers. Over the complete process, each project is matter for team of highly qualified specialists. A net of international subsidiaries and foreign representations all important industrial nations ensure the close contact to our customers worldwide and guarantee excellent level of service. Our Supply- Chain-Management has been designed to meet all the demands of global market structure. We manage all the activities along the value chain comprehensively and thus ensure optimal degree of delivery service – all parts of the world. In addition, we put greatest emphasis on process-oriented production highest quality. All the developments of ABM Greiffenberger undergo intensive tests for which we use the latest testing technology. This guarantees that they meet all the technical demands. We design all the products our own house. Components that constitute core competence are being produced process-reliably on our own ultra-modern facilities.” How do you judge the current economic situation the industrial sectors? Peter Dittmers: „In general, the economic situation is currently encouragingly positive. Using school marks, I would give good to very good. Right now, we notice certain reluctance the sector of renewable energies. This is connected to the fact that the oil price is still on relatively low level.“ Which strategic aims does ABM pursue? Robert Lackermeier: „ABM Greiffenberger consistently continues along the path of absolute customer and sector orientation. Our employees keep their ears to the market and maintain permanent, intensive exchange with our customers. Combined with our extensive experience, we offer highest competence development and engineering. Therefore, we are constantly focusing our attention on successfully generating customized solutions further on. At ABM Greiffenberger, globalization is lived reality. However, there is no standstill here. We want to expand our international presence and this way win additional market shares the respective sectors worldwide.“ In which areas/sectors does ABM still see potential for development? Robert Lackermeier: „A current topic is unchangedly the energy efficiency. The challenge to produce top-performances with energy efficient drives and motors keep us intensely occupied for years to come. And this mega-trend to minimize the energy consumption runs through many sectors. In this respect, we see considerable potential for development many industrial sectors. This is true for the mechanical engineering as well as for the intra logistics and the inventory logistics. There is considerable potential here for the electric mobility, industrial trucks and the lifting technology. The saving of energy is not sector-specific concern.“ From the point of view of ABM, what are the trend topics of the future? Robert Lackermeier: „As already mentioned earlier, what be important is to further optimize the power density of the drives. The demands on such systems are high. Turnover rates and throughput speeds are increasing. Modern drives have to master these challenges to keep up with another trend: to deliver the goods just-in-time at the customers’. From our point of view, the sensorless control of IE 4 Motors is important topic for the future.“ Specifically: Which role does the topic Industry 4.0 play from your point of view? Peter Dittmers: „The global networking is constantly increasing. Machines and components communicate with each other, exchange information and react accordingly. Decision-making power is being decentralized. This development is just at the beginning and still have to take many hurdles. But we believe that the topic Industry 4.0 get ever increasing importance.“ Mr. Dittmers: You are the new sales manager at ABM. Which targets are you going to dedicate yourself to? Peter Dittmers: „For my new work to which I looking forward to very much, I have set myself whole number of targets. One of them is the introduction of process-oriented global sales. The customers worldwide shall be supplied quickly and reliably with the products and solutions they desire. I do not only want to generate customer satisfaction, but make it measurable. Successful work sales and distribution is reflected good sales figures. Therefore, it is my aim to raise the turnover considerably. In order to reach very high customer satisfaction, I want to make the sales department even more efficient and to organize it strategically optimal way. For our customers, the parameters quality, on-time deliveries, price and global availability are of very high importance. Here we have invested lot over the past years order to meet the customers’ requirements. Global delivery logistics is elementary topic for us. We can offer customized solutions worldwide here. ABM is very well positioned for successful future.“ Picture 1: Robert Lackermeier, Geschäftsführer, ABM Greiffenberger Picture 2: Peter Dittmers, CSO at ABM Greiffenberger Picture 3: Drives of ABM Greiffenberger are being produced on ultra-modern facilities (for example: automatic packaging-, welding- and isolation cell) Diese Seite drucken Anfrage Seite stellen

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - ABM Greiffenberger: www.abm-antriebe.de - ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH Pfad: Home - News - ABM Greiffenberger: Internetadresse: www.abm-antriebe.de/7800_abm_greiffenberger_.html Stand: 13.08.2015 18:23:27 zurück Startseite Customer and Sector Orientation ABM Greiffenberger: Consistently continue along the path of absolute customer and sector orientation ABM Greiffenberger is among the leading international system suppliers of upmarket, efficient drive solutions for machines, installations and mobile devices. In the interview, the Managing Director, Mr. Robert Lackermeier and the new ABM-Sales Manager, Mr. Peter Dittmers examine current developments and challenges of the sector. Optimal flexibility and strict customer orientation are the top topics. ABM is present many sectors with drive solutions. What are the advantages of the company? Robert Lackermeier: „ABM Greiffenberger pays greatest attention to optimal flexibility order to be able to react quickly and accurately to the customers‘ wishes. The development of powerful customized drive solutions is one of our key strengths. Our modularly structured, diversified product range enables us to offer perfectly adjusted solutions. We are fulfilling high rate of on-time deliveries order to satisfy our customers. Over the complete process, each project is matter for team of highly qualified specialists. A net of international subsidiaries and foreign representations all important industrial nations ensure the close contact to our customers worldwide and guarantee excellent level of service. Our Supply- Chain-Management has been designed to meet all the demands of global market structure. We manage all the activities along the value chain comprehensively and thus ensure optimal degree of delivery service – all parts of the world. In addition, we put greatest emphasis on process-oriented production highest quality. All the developments of ABM Greiffenberger undergo intensive tests for which we use the latest testing technology. This guarantees that they meet all the technical demands. We design all the products our own house. Components that constitute core competence are being produced process-reliably on our own ultra-modern facilities.” How do you judge the current economic situation the industrial sectors? Peter Dittmers: „In general, the economic situation is currently encouragingly positive. Using school marks, I would give good to very good. Right now, we notice certain reluctance the sector of renewable energies. This is connected to the fact that the oil price is still on relatively low level.“ Which strategic aims does ABM pursue? Robert Lackermeier: „ABM Greiffenberger consistently continues along the path of absolute customer and sector orientation. Our employees keep their ears to the market and maintain permanent, intensive exchange with our customers. Combined with our extensive experience, we offer highest competence development and engineering. Therefore, we are constantly focusing our attention on successfully generating customized solutions further on. At ABM Greiffenberger, globalization is lived reality. However, there is no standstill here. We want to expand our international presence and this way win additional market shares the respective sectors worldwide.“ In which areas/sectors does ABM still see potential for development? Robert Lackermeier: „A current topic is unchangedly the energy efficiency. The challenge to produce top-performances with energy efficient drives and motors keep us intensely occupied for years to come. And this mega-trend to minimize the energy consumption runs through many sectors. In this respect, we see considerable potential for development many industrial sectors. This is true for the mechanical engineering as well as for the intra logistics and the inventory logistics. There is considerable potential here for the electric mobility, industrial trucks and the lifting technology. The saving of energy is not sector-specific concern.“ From the point of view of ABM, what are the trend topics of the future? Robert Lackermeier: „As already mentioned earlier, what be important is to further optimize the power density of the drives. The demands on such systems are high. Turnover rates and throughput speeds are increasing. Modern drives have to master these challenges to keep up with another trend: to deliver the goods just-in-time at the customers’. From our point of view, the sensorless control of IE 4 Motors is important topic for the future.“ Specifically: Which role does the topic Industry 4.0 play from your point of view? Peter Dittmers: „The global networking is constantly increasing. Machines and components communicate with each other, exchange information and react accordingly. Decision-making power is being decentralized. This development is just at the beginning and still have to take many hurdles. But we believe that the topic Industry 4.0 get ever increasing importance.“ Mr. Dittmers: You are the new sales manager at ABM. Which targets are you going to dedicate yourself to? Peter Dittmers: „For my new work to which I looking forward to very much, I have set myself whole number of targets. One of them is the introduction of process-oriented global sales. The customers worldwide shall be supplied quickly and reliably with the products and solutions they desire. I do not only want to generate customer satisfaction, but make it measurable. Successful work sales and distribution is reflected good sales figures. Therefore, it is my aim to raise the turnover considerably. In order to reach very high customer satisfaction, I want to make the sales department even more efficient and to organize it strategically optimal way. For our customers, the parameters quality, on-time deliveries, price and global availability are of very high importance. Here we have invested lot over the past years order to meet the customers’ requirements. Global delivery logistics is elementary topic for us. We can offer customized solutions worldwide here. ABM is very well positioned for successful future.“ Picture 1: Robert Lackermeier, Geschäftsführer, ABM Greiffenberger Picture 2: Peter Dittmers, CSO at ABM Greiffenberger Picture 3: Drives of ABM Greiffenberger are being produced on ultra-modern facilities (for example: automatic packaging-, welding- and isolation cell)

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - Systems Solution www.abm-antriebe.de - ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH Pfad: Home - News - Systems Solution Internetadresse: www.abm-antriebe.de/7686_systems_solution.html Stand: 13.08.2015 18:23:29 zurück Startseite Controller improves processes warehouse logistics Systems Solution New controller improves processes warehouse logistics At the LogiMAT Stuttgart, ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH presents new controller for intralogistics. It is highly versatile and improves processes the container conveyor technology. It shows its strengths especially combination with energy-efficient gear units and motors of ABM Greiffenberger. For the time being, the new controller has been designed for motor power of up to 0.75 kW and works with asynchronous motors as well as permanently excited motors at temperature range of -30° up to +50°C without any problems. The ABM Sinochron Motors can be operated sensorless without encoder feedback and they are extremely reliable. In practice, they are distinguished by high efficiencies, high power density and compact dimensions. The new controller of ABM Greiffenberger is suitable for many applications the container conveyor technology. Users can install the controller and put it into operation very easily. Pluggable connections ensure the easy and process-reliable installation. Preassembled cables can be connected without any special tools. An NFC interface ensures the quick start of operations of the BUS-compatible controllers. Users adjust the necessary parameters according to the operating conditions simply by means of Near Field Communication (NFC) via PC or Smartphone-App. The decentralized controller has been designed for the direct assembly to the motor. Alternatively, it can be attached to the wall, separated from the motor. Moreover, several drives can be operated from one common power supply (Daisy Chain). The aluminium die-cast housing is light but robust. It can be used without any problems even harsh environmental conditions. The ABM novelty can be flexibly used many intralogistics applications of the container conveyor technology e.g. roller conveyors, belt conveyors or curved conveyors. In warehouse logistics, quick and process-reliable handling of goods is necessary order to fulfill the customers‘ requirements for prompt supply. Therefore, especially the conveyor technology must show the highest equipment availability. The roller, belt and curved conveyors which are mainly used are being combined depending on the specific plant. It is advantageous to use angular gear drive as necessary drive unit as it can be space-savingly installed to the conveyor technology then. For this case, ABM Greiffenberger offers system solutions as e.g. the angular gear KG62 connection with the SINOCHRON® Motor and mounted controller. The drive combinations are highly versatile and offer efficient solutions for quick and reliable handling of goods.

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - Powerful drives for industrial trucks www.abm-antriebe.de - ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH Pfad: Home - News - Powerful drives for industrial trucks Internetadresse: www.abm-antriebe.de/7688_powerful_drives_for_industrial_trucks.html Stand: 13.08.2015 18:23:31 zurück Startseite System Integration Material Handling Powerful drives for industrial trucks System Integration Material Handling As system supplier for drives of the material handling technology, ABM offers complete, precisely matched and highly efficient drive systems for industrial trucks. At the LogiMAT Stuttgart, the company – located the Bavarian town Marktredwitz – presents among other things powerful ABM bevel gear units of the series TDB 254 for the system integration. The cost-saving encoder feedback is new the program. Bevel gear units of the series TDB 254 distinguish themselves through their high torque transmission capacity, very quiet running and long service life. The encoder feedback, newly developed by ABM, is cost-effective alternative to concepts with potentiometers and is integrated into the intermediate flange. This prevents soiling as it can happen hitherto existing solutions with encoders next to the driving wheel. For the user, ABM’s solution is easily accessible from the top case it needs servicing. Moreover, it can be used flexibly with different sensors. The bevel gear units of the series TDB 254 excel with very quiet running and have been furnished with encoder feedback. The series TDB 254 is highly efficient and is used large number of industrial trucks. Vehicle developers can now respond even better to customer-specific requirements and have the choice either to use smaller, more cost-effective batteries for the same operating time or to design the vehicles for longer operating times until the next charging process. The complete gear design has been tailored to the mobile use and is especially robust. The unit works with high process reliability even rough environmental conditions and at temperatures of down to minus 40°C. The quiet running of the drives increases the driving comfort. The efficient dynamics improves the productivity of the vehicles practice. The bevel gear units TDB 254 are being used different mobile machines. The range reaches from hand pallet trucks and commissioners, reach trucks and tractors to driverless transport systems (FTS). Outside the material handling technology, the ABM solution aims at applications like cleaning machines and working platforms. ABM Greiffenberger presents another system solution: the wheel hub drive of the series TDH 280. It is especially suited for the use cleaning vehicles like sweepers and sweep-vacuum vehicles. The drive with wheel diameter of 280 millimetres works reliably transport systems that are being used damp surroundings. ABM offers the wheel hub drive as three-stage helical/planetary gear unit with integrated AC-motor, holding brake, speed- and thermosensor. The designing engineers attach great importance to serviceability: TDH 280 is completely maintenance-free. Its robust design masters even difficult tasks rough production surroundings without any problems. The drive is supplied with battery voltage of 36 Volt and does 1.2 kW. The ABM innovation has compact design with small envelope circle. Its small height makes the installation easy. The concept of this wheel hub can easily be integrated different types of vehicles and is especially suited for concepts with low platform height through its small installation height. The wheel hub drive of the series TDH 280 is especially well suited for the use cleaning machines. For the use 3-wheel counterbalanced trucks with load of up to two tons, ABM presents the steering unit SDH. It works as three-stage helical gearbox with mounted AC-motor. The battery voltage is 48 Volt, the output 0.9 kW. The component has been designed as complete motor-gearbox-sensor-unit. This steering unit is extremely service-friendly, maintenance work is not necessary. With the series SDH, the system supplier offers the users cost-optimized steering concept. The gear unit has efficiency of 94%. Through its compact design, the steering unit SDH can easily be mounted lift trucks and it has proved its robust design many times practice at high load demands. Steering unit SDH for the use counterbalanced trucks with load of up to two tons. 20 years experience material handling For 20 years now, ABM Greiffenberger has been manufacturing AC-drives for material handling applications and can bank on comprehensive know-how as system supplier for the industrial truck industry. More than 2 million drives have been integrated into the applications of the material handling area up until today. The drive specialist works closely together with the customer all the way from the development phase to the series production and offers the best possible solutions from single source for the respective applications the areas driving, lifting or steering. The system solutions of ABM excel with their high output at low energy consumption and little maintenance work. They guarantee long service life and process reliability, have compact design and can be integrated into machines with very little development effort. The use of the newest gearbox and motor technology is proof of the high environmental awareness of the company. Drive solutions of ABM – from the extensive construction kit system or customized – are convincing through their exemplary energy efficiency.

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - Powerful & Durable www.abm-antriebe.de - ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH Pfad: Home - News - Powerful & Durable Internetadresse: www.abm-antriebe.de/7690_powerful_durable.html Stand: 13.08.2015 18:23:34 zurück Startseite Energy efficient drives for electric vehicles ABM Greiffenberger Energy efficient drives for electric vehicles For decades, ABM Greiffenberger has been one of the world leading manufacturers of electric drive unit systems for battery powered vehicles. The company, located the Bavarian town Marktredwitz, offers efficient system solutions from single source for high performance with low energy use. At the LogiMAT Stuttgart, ABM presents among other things the drive motor 45 kW. This motor increases the performance of electric vehicles considerably. Manufacturers of electric vehicles need well thought-out drive technology with best performance. In addition to economical driving techniques and good aerodynamics, order to travel long distances, first and foremost efficient drive components are required. Electric vehicles must reach the permissible speeds town as well as on urban motorways and country roads. In its AC-motor portfolio, ABM offers suitable solutions up to 45kW for light electric vehicles of the classes L7e and M1 with formally not restricted speed. The maximum torque of 130 Nm of the 45kW drive motor creates the precondition for dynamic accelerating and high driving pleasure. The lightweight construction with weight of only 43 kilogram fulfills the high demands on vehicle weight and payload. The large field weakening range of the motor allows high climbing ability and fast driving without manual transmission. Thanks to high power density and efficient air cooling, this drive reaches efficiency of up to 93 %. The motor reaches maximum speed of 8,000 rpm. The 45 kW motor of ABM Greiffenberger with maximum torque of 130 Nm ensures dynamic acceleration. In Stuttgart, ABM shows energy efficient Sinochron motors for auxiliary units and attachments as they are used commercial vehicles, busses, agricultural machinery and construction machines, but the area of material handling. The drive is permanently energized synchronous motor with high efficiency, great power density and compact dimensions. The special design of the rotor with built-in magnets leads to almost ideal sinusoidal distribution of the magnetic flux. Therefore, Sinochron motors are especially well suited for sensorless controlled operation. That way, they are economic alternative to expensive servo drives. As there is no external magnetization, there are no losses the rotor through magnetizing currents. Therefore, Sinochron motors of ABM Greiffenberger reach constantly high efficiency almost the complete speed range. The rotor’s design is simple and robust. The complete sensor technology for speed measurement and position detection with its connectors can be left out. This ensures very high reliability and availability. Sinochron motors are predestined for all applications with constant torque the complete speed range and heavily fluctuating loads. In Stuttgart, ABM presents energy efficient Sinochron motors for auxiliary units and attachments High competence as system supplier ABM Greiffenberger offers gearboxes, motors, brakes and drive controls from single source and has high competence as system supplier for customer-specific solutions. Problematic steps between various suppliers are thus avoided. The established competence of the company stretches over all processes: from the in-house construction of tools and fixtures and aluminium-casting foundry, CNC-machining of the housings to the manufacturing of shafts and cutting of gear teeth, from the motor winding technology to the assembly and final testing of the products. In addition to intensive research and development work, ABM Greiffenberger attaches great importance to reliable production. The company uses the latest technology like laser-assisted measurement systems. Endurance tests and 100% checks round off this package of measures. This thorough network of testing ensures the high reliability of the ABM products.

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - Donations instead of gifts www.abm-antriebe.de - ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH Pfad: Home - News - Donations instead of gifts Internetadresse: www.abm-antriebe.de/7692_donations_instead_of_gifts.html Stand: 13.08.2015 18:23:36 zurück Startseite ABM Greiffenberger shows its social commitment Donations instead of gifts ABM Greiffenberger shows its social commitment again ABM Greiffenberger is well aware of its social responsibility for the region and gives its support where help is really needed. For the sixth time row now, ABM Greiffenberger supported different projects and organizations instead of sending the usual tokens of appreciation to customers and business partners at Christmas. At the end of last year, the following organizations received donation already: Glücksmomente e.V., Achern: With our donation, 10 mentally and physically handicapped children from the district of Wunsiedel can attend riding therapy sessions for month. Kinderhilfe Eckental GmbH, Eckental: The clinic Fichtelgebirge Marktredwitz received 25 consolation teddies. They divert the little patients and accompany the children to check-ups and treatments. Tagesmütter Landkreis Wunsiedel e.V.: With this support, the rooms of the multigenerational house „Die Strolche“ be furnished further. Moreover, 3.000 € were donated from the proceeds of raffle „ It is important that socially committed companies do not shut their eyes to problems. We want to contribute to the well-being of the people our region and therefore, we are very happy to support two more organizations with donation from the proceeds of our Christmas party raffle. While doing this, it is very important for us to know that 100% of our support reaches those people who need it most. “, explains Robert Lackermeier, CEO at ABM Greiffenberger. One part of the proceeds goes to the Kinder- Jugendhilfezentrum St. Josef Wunsiedel. Joachim Lehmann, head of the Kinder- Jugendhilfezentrums St. Josef expressed his thanks for the generous donation. „ With it, ABM Greiffenberger gives us opportunity for activities and actions, projects and acquisitions that can otherwise only rarely be financed .“ Moreover, the Kinder- Jugendhilfezentrum St. Josef received the first prize of the raffle. Wolfgang Benzing, sector manager for e-mobility at ABM Greiffenberger, had won this first prize – table football table. He forwarded it to St. Josef with the words: „ I hope, the children and young people have lot of fun with it .“ The second part of the proceeds is used to support the newly founded social counselling for asylum seekers that called into being by the circle of supporters for refugees Arzberg at the beginning of this year. Alexander Wagner (AWO Arzberg) and Guenther Beyer accepted the cheque on behalf of the circle of supporters for refugees that consists of 20 people from totally different sectors of society. Both expressed their heartfelt thanks the name of the asylum seekers. With the earmarked donation, language courses for the refugees staying shared accommodation be made possible. Learning the German language helps them to overcome language barriers and thus become faster integrated our country. Handing over of the cheque to the Kinder- Jugendhilfezentrum St. Josef and the Flüchtlingshilfe Arzberg: F.l.t.r.: Ann-Katrin Eiser (Division management Kinder- Jugendhilfezentrum St. Josef), Joachim Lehmann (Head of the Kinder- Jugendhilfezentrum St. Josef), Robert Lackermeier (CEO of ABM Greiffenberger), Alexander Wagner (AWO Arzberg), Guenther Beyer (Circle of Supporters for Refugees) and Hermann Ransberger (Chairman of the works council at ABM Greiffenberger)

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - LogiMAT 2015 www.abm-antriebe.de - ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH Pfad: Home - News - LogiMAT 2015 Internetadresse: www.abm-antriebe.de/7661_logimat_2015.html Stand: 13.08.2015 18:23:38 zurück Startseite ABM presents efficient drive technology ABM Greiffenberger with efficient drive technology at the LogiMAT 2015 At the LogiMAT (Stuttgart, 10th to 12th February 2015) hall 1, booth 1A31, ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH presents excerpt of the company’s extensive portfolio from the areas storage techniques, forklift trucks and e-mobility. Among other things, new controller for the storage sector be on display. It is versatile and enhances the processes the container conveyor technology. For the time being, the new controller has been designed for motor power of 0.75 kW and works without any problem at temperatures from -30° up to +50°C. The sensorless control has been perfectly adjusted to the ABM Sinochron motors. Pluggable connections can easily be reached from outside and several drives can be operated from one power supply. Users adjust the necessary parameters by means of Near Field Communication (NFC) via PC or Smartphone-App. The service-friendly controller has been designed for the direct assembly to the motor. Alternatively, it can be attached to the wall, separated from the motor. Its very compact design with aluminium die-cast housing allows easy, quick installation. The ABM innovation can be used many intra-logistics applications of the container conveyor technology roller conveyors, belt conveyors or curved conveyors. The new controller of ABM Greiffenberger is suitable for many applications the container conveyor technology Energy-efficient SINOCHRON®Motors In the area of storage logistics, ABM Greiffenberger shows energy-efficient SINOCHRON® motors as compact drive units for roller conveyors. They work with high process reliability at temperatures of -30° up to +45°C and are therefore suited for the use deep-freeze rooms. SINOCHRON® motors reach highest efficiencies the part-load operational range and are that way lowering the energy costs. The drive unit without gearbox provides top plant availability. It moves mobile loads of up to 180 kilogram and reaches conveying velocities of 0.3 up to 1.2 m/s. SINOCHRON® Motors of ABM reach the highest efficiency the part-load operational range and are saving energy that way Maintenance-free and easy to install angular gear units Two-stage angular gear units of the KG-series of ABM with nominal torques of up to 700 Nm be on display. They are maintenance-free and easy to mount because of their angular design. The gearboxes are available two executions, full shaft and hollow shaft. They are suited for the assembly to asynchronous or Sinochron motors. The KG-series, made of aluminium die-cast (Al 230), has smooth, dirt-repellent surface and convinces with high corrosion resistance. The shaft-mounted helical gear units of the FGA-series of ABM have been designed for output of 50 to 2,300 Nm. The two-, three- and four-stage gear units only need little space due to their compact design and offer significant advantages for the assembly with their large shaft centre distance. Top-quality toothing makes them low-noise and durable. Apart from corrosion resistance, the aluminium motor and gearbox housings offer considerable advantages for the assembly due to their little weight. Compact drives for electric vehicles The SINOCHRON® drives for auxiliary units, which ABM presents the area of e-mobility, are energy-efficient, durable and compact. The motors have sensorless control, are compact and cost-efficient. Electronic controllers, which have been optimized for the special application, considerably reduce losses the entire use and thus increase the energy efficiency of the system. ABM offers travel drives like the 22 / 45 kW motor for smaller electric vehicles as well. The maximum torque of 130 Nm establishes the pre-condition for dynamic accelerating and high driving pleasure. The large field weakening range of the motors allows high climbing ability and fast driving without manual transmission. Thanks to high power spectrum and efficient air cooling, this drive reaches efficiencies of up to 93%. The SINOCHRON® Motors developed by ABM Greiffenberger are perfectly suited to serve as energy-saving drive of auxiliary units utility vehicles Bevel gear units with high torque For the industrial sector of forklift trucks, ABM shows bevel gear units of the series TDB 254. With their high torque transmission capacity, quiet running and longevity, they are particularly suited for mobile applications such as forklift trucks and commissioners. The encoder feedback developed by ABM is new. It is cost-efficient alternative to concepts with potentiometer. The encoder feedback is integrated into the intermediate flange. The encoder itself is easily accessible from the top case it needs servicing. This prevents soiling as it can happen hitherto existing solutions with encoders next to the driving wheel. The ABM novelty can be used flexibly with different sensors. As system supplier the forklift truck sector, ABM Greiffenberger offers complete, precisely matched and highly efficient drive systems including travel and steering motor. The ABM bevel gear units of the series TDB 254 have now been furnished with cost-efficient encoder feedback The wheel hub drive of the series TDH 280 of ABM presented Stuttgart is suitable for the use cleaning machines and transport systems damp surroundings. It is maintenance-free, robust and designed as complete unity of motor, brake and gearbox. It is supplied with battery voltage of 36 Volt and does 1.2 kW. Its compact design allows small installation heights and makes the installation into the vehicle easy. For the use counterbalanced trucks up to load of 2.0 t, ABM has developed the steering unit SDH as three-stage helical gearbox with mounted AC-motor. The battery voltage is 48 Volt, the output 0.9 kW. The geared unit as complete motor-gearbox-unit has been designed for high load demands and can easily be mounted forklift trucks. The ABM development is cost-optimized design and convinces with efficiency of 94%. ABM Greiffenberger at the LogiMAT: Hall 1, booth 1A31

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - ABM Greiffenberger welcomes nine new trainees www.abm-antriebe.de - ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH Pfad: Home - News - ABM Greiffenberger welcomes nine new trainees Internetadresse: www.abm-antriebe.de/7639_abm_greiffenberger_welcomes_nine_new_trainees.html Stand: 13.08.2015 18:23:41 zurück Startseite The motor behind our success Jobs with future ABM Greiffenberger welcomes nine new trainees Today, nine new trainees start their apprenticeship or dual degree program at ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH Marktredwitz. So the training year 2014/15, the company employs total of 29 trainees. Five of them are young women who have decided to learn technical occupation. “ We place great importance on motivated and qualified specialists from our own ranks – they are the motor behind our success “, says Robert Lackermeier, Managing Director at ABM Greiffenberger. “ Therefore, we are sustainably promoting new blood for our own requirements – e.g. with diversified working environment modern training workshop, own ABM Academy and last but not least with extensive preparations for the exams .“ Candidates for 2015 are now welcome to apply ABM Greiffenberger offers training for the following occupational areas: electronic engineer for machines and drive technology, mechatronic engineer, the dual degree program industrial engineering / mechatronics, tool and metal-cutting mechanics. Also for 2015 can already be applied. For more information, please visit the career portal on our website at: www.abm-drives.com Left to right: Dominik Sagolla (Youth Representative), Ottmar Wiche (Deputy Chairman of the Works Council), Yannik Mueller, Christoph Moeller, Patrick Wegmann, Jeremia Frenzel, Johannes Herrmann, Jessica Dirks, Niclas Dollinger, David Wood, Johannes Zinnecker, Susanne Strauß (Personnel Management), Hermann Ransberger (Chairman of the Works Council), Bernhard Wenning (Training Manager)

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - SINOCHRON® motors www.abm-antriebe.de - ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH Pfad: Home - News - SINOCHRON® motors Internetadresse: www.abm-antriebe.de/7625_sinochron%C2%AE_motors.html Stand: 13.08.2015 18:23:43 zurück Startseite More efficiency for logistics SINOCHRON® motors from ABM Greiffenberger: More efficiency for logistics In warehouse logistics, fast and reliable material handling is guarantee of success. ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH developed the innovative SINOCHRON® motors that meet the increased requirements for effective logistic solutions. The highly dynamic motors are extremely energy-efficient and have excellent control characteristics. The ABM innovation demonstrates its strength the partial load range particular. In intralogistics, especially material handling, more than two out of three drive units are operated the partial load range. That means that the full torque provided by the motor is applied only briefly for starting the load. Afterwards, drive units usually operate at 20 to 30 percent of the nominal load. This is exactly the range the SINOCHRON® drive unit excels in. The decisive factor is permanently excited synchronous motor without virtually any rotor losses. Unlike the widely used asynchronous machine, synchronous motors generally stand out due to their high efficiency, great power density and compact format. Conventional synchronous drive units need speed sensor when operating with servo controller or frequency converter. Thanks to the special characteristics of the ABM development, SINOCHRON® motors are perfectly suited for operation with sensorless control and thus they represent economic alternative to expensive servo drive units. At the same time, they stand out against asynchronous motors because of higher dynamic response and better efficiency. SINOCHRON® motor from ABM Greiffenberger with attached frequency converter and optimal efficiency the partial load range. The drive unit with sensorless control stands out particular due to its highly dynamic and efficient performance. The SINOCHRON® development excels efficiency, especially the partial load range, thanks to the use of high-quality neodymium-iron-boron magnets that prevent rotor losses. A further advantage of the ABM innovation is the high power density, resulting smaller construction volume compared to asynchronous motors. In material handling particular, drive solutions are often installed with high space restrictions. The compact ABM solution can be used efficiently even case of small system dimensions. The simple and robust design as well as the omission of mechanical speed sensor including wiring make the SINOCHRON® motor highly reliable with very harsh environmental conditions, such as cold stores. The drive unit is designed for use temperature range down to minus 30 degrees. A good run-out is another advantage of these motors. They contrast with asynchronous motors due to approximately double short-time overload capacity. This creates the precondition for choosing smaller motor many cases. It does not only reduce installation space but energy consumption. SINOCHRON® motors from ABM Greiffenberger are used as conveyor drive units, textile and packaging machines, industrial doors, screw compressors and medical engineering.

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - For Intralogistics www.abm-antriebe.de - ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH Pfad: Home - News - For Intralogistics Internetadresse: www.abm-antriebe.de/7621_for_intralogistics.html Stand: 13.08.2015 18:23:44 zurück Startseite Powerful angular gearbox Powerful angular gearbox by ABM Greiffenberger for intralogistics ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH has developed the efficient angular gearbox KG 62 for versatile applications intralogistics. Amongst others, the two-stage gearbox convinces through its high power density with efficiency of up to 96 percent. Furthermore, the special design allows installation with minimum space requirements. The innovation by ABM with drive torque of up to 60 Nm has very compact design. Both asynchronous and SINOCHRON® motor types are used. For applications with SINOCHRON® motor, it is possible to integrate converter. Interfaces are thus no longer necessary. The highly efficient angular gearbox KG 62 convinces through its high power density with efficiency of up to 96 percent. Intralogistics offer wide range of possible applications. For that purpose, ABM Greiffenberger developed highly flexible drive unit solution, amongst others the new angular gearbox. The different versions of the KG 62 with optimum adjustment of electrical and mechanical drive parameters provide the user with various mounting options. For example, the motor controller SDC can be used directly on the motor or as stand-alone version. Modern drive unit solutions must operate smoothly and precisely, especially under difficult conditions. The ABM innovation guarantees high dynamic response and reliability even under harsh environmental conditions, for example when used cold warehouses. The angular gearbox is made of diecast aluminium what makes it light, robust and provides it with smooth, highly corrosion-resistant surface. Moreover, plug-in connectors ensure easy assembly and installation. This saves both time and money. The gearbox is used amongst others roller conveyors and belt conveyors for applications container conveyor technology. In this case, logistics planners often face the challenge of integrating much equipment into small spaces. Due to its compact design, the ABM innovation meets these requirements. The gearbox KG 62 angular design ensures optimum structural adaptation to existing installation situations, even under limited space conditions.

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - For Material Handling Applications www.abm-antriebe.de - ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH Pfad: Home - News - For Material Handling Applications Internetadresse: www.abm-antriebe.de/7617_for_material_handling_applications.html Stand: 13.08.2015 18:23:46 zurück Startseite New Shaft Mounted Helical Gearbox New shaft mounted helical gearbox for material handling applications Compact, highly efficient and quiet: this is what is expected of gearboxes used conveyor systems of intralogistics. The new shaft mounted helical gearbox suits this property profile. The shaft-mounted helical gearbox FGA 283 bridges the gap of the FGA series between the FGA 103 and the FGA 453 which presented 2013. It is suitable for the transmission of maximum torques of up to 280 Nm and thus for numerous typical applications intralogistics, for example conveyor belt drives, but for the drive units of vertical conveyors, rotary tables and storage and retrieval machines. Thanks to the large centre distance between the motor and the output shaft, the FGA 283 can be attached to the conveyor systems, requiring very little space. The motor is mounted underneath the conveyor belt. The newly developed FGA 283 complements the power spectrum of the shaft mounted helical gear series. Thanks to its high overall efficiency, this gear is true professional energy saving. The high-quality helical gearing of the FGA 283 creates the precondition for extremely high energy efficiency and low noise emission. Both the gearing and the aluminium housing originate from the production of ABM Greiffenberger. The great variety of fastening possibilities is typical feature of the entire FGA series. As before, the user can choose between four-point mounting, B14 or B5 flange as well as the application as slip-on gear with torque support. Further characteristics of the FGA 283 are its high overload capacity and durability – well-known feature of all gearboxes and gear motors of ABM Greiffenberger. It is for this reason that many manufacturers of material handling systems and material handling vehicles use gearboxes and complete drive systems of ABM Greiffenberger.

ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH - Home - News - Maintenance-free Drives www.abm-antriebe.de - ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH Pfad: Home - News - Maintenance-free Drives Internetadresse: www.abm-antriebe.de/7614_maintenance_free_drives.html Stand: 13.08.2015 18:23:48 zurück Startseite SINOCHRON® motors driving WITRON logistics Maintenance-free SINOCHRON® Motors of ABM Greiffenberger driving Witron logistics WITRON’s accumulated roller conveyer systems, which are integrated into ultra-modern distribution centres for commerce and industry, have length between 100 metres and sometimes up to 10 kilometres. Therefore, the requirements of the drive technology the plants are very high. An innovation of ABM Greiffenberger is important component with regard to availability and energy efficiency of the WITRON plants. The SINOCHRON® motor, developed by ABM, operates maintenance-free as direct drive and reduces at the component level the energy consumption up to 40 per cent within the conveyor systems compared to centrally driven roller conveyors. WITRON Logistik + Informatik GmbH with registered office Parkstein, located Northern Bavaria, is planning and carrying out innovative logistics and material flow systems from one source. As general contractor the company deals with logistics planning, information, control technology, mechanics construction, and fabrication. WITRON takes responsiblity for functionality and is servicing every project from start to finish. Several top companies running their distribution centres successfully with WITRON solutions for already many years. There is strong demand for the highly dynamic logistics and order picking systems of WITRON. The core markets are currently the regions within Europe and the USA. However, growing markets Russia and Asia is on WITRON’s future radar screen. The company employs approximately 2,000 people around the world. WITRON’s sales revenue grew 20% 2012 to 240 million euros. Regardless of size, range, or performance of project, numerous WITRON customers the food retailing, e-commerce, electronics, service and spare parts distribution, general merchandise, pharmaceutics, textile or freeze logistics industry are setting high demands on the material handling and drive technology. For example, the Swiss retailer Migros, located Suhr, is operating one of Europe’s most modern logistics high-performance plants since 2011. An Order Picking Machinery (OPM) system developed by WITRON with sophisticated process chain ensures every day, that all products of total of 3,500 different articles are delivered on time. At peak days, 28 COM machines picking up approximately 315.000 commercial units economically and without fault. About 3.000 ABM Greiffenberger drive units successfully run the 5.5 km long material handling system. The roller conveyors are built by Förder Anlagen Systeme (FAS), wholly-owned subsidiary of WITRON. For permanent further development of FAS systems, where experts are carefully examine all used components regarding construction, productivity and availability. “ One of the objectives to standardise the diversity of types of the FAS conveyor elements “, says Stephan Schmid, who is the team leader for development of control technology at WITRON. In the past, material handling systems with centrally driven accumulating roller conveyors have been used at WITRON. “Due to our long-term operating and field experience, we were looking for non-wearing drive units, gearless, without brakes, energy efficient, and with high availability ”, says Schmid. Shortly after Schmid’s comment, first conversations took place with several suppliers at certain exhibitions and closer look taken at different solutions. During intensive technical workshops with ABM, common ground found relatively quickly order to find the right partner, describes Stephan Schmid. ABM Greiffenberger’s Sales Manager for industrial applications Wolfgang Wegmann has confirmed, that the constructive and target oriented conversations have been the reason for common success from the very first day. After first line of samples released and submitted at the beginning of 2009, planning, development, and series implementation have been completed within few months. Before that, WITRON and ABM have successfully tested SINOCHRON® drive solutions to various performance outcomes. “ As option for development gearless drive, without sensors, and without brakes. Therefore, we have developed custom-made drive unit for WITRON ”, says Wegmann. Good concentricity and energy efficiency The SINOCHRON® motor, build by ABM, is energy-saving alternative to the central drive unit and the so-called “roller drives”. This motor is characterized by good concentricity performance. The SINOCHRON® motor differs from asynchronous motor by short-term overload capacity, which is approximately twice as much. The result many cases is that smaller motor can be chosen for application, which reduces space and energy consumption. “ In reality, the operator of material handling plant saves up to 40 per cent energy compared to conventional central drive unit. Especially larger material handling plants, high potential saving energy cost during the life cycle of the plant is very likely ”, says Wegmann. ABM offers with the SINOCHRON® motor as decentralised drive unit system, which motor, brake, gear box and electronics are integrated one compact structural unit. An intelligent modular system guarantees that the optimal drive unit can be implemented every possible application. Different models of gear boxes are available, such as bevel, helical and shaft mounted helical gearbox, which are developed and manufactured in-house and optimized for the performance values of each corresponding motor. The modular principle of the drive systems fulfils very special requirements of plant manufacturers with serial components. “ This has positive impact on quality, because only reliable modules are used ”, says Wegmann. No possible oil loss “ WITRON and its customers have received maintenance-free system components from ABM Greiffenberger. Therefore, no loss of oil is guaranteed ”, says Wolfgang Wegmann. Another advantage of the SINOCHRON® drive unit is the use freezer stores. The SINOCHRON® drive unit and its design are configured to run the temperature of up to minus 30 degrees Celsius. The ABM solution shows its strengths the way it developed and build. Wolfgang Wegmann says further: “ Because of the built-on controller technology, decentralised drive unit has clearly reduced the engineering expenditure .“ According to WITRON, the ABM system has met all initially defined goals and requirements “ This has been proven during long-term system installations the field ”, says Stephan Schmid. Because of the positive experiences, the ABM development is used for modernisations and total overhauls of older plants the field. Quality and reliability of the SINOCHRON® drive units contribute to the high quality of the WITRON logistics system. “ The output and energy cost savings is convincing factor for us ,” but the large variety of applications. “The drive units operate reliably at temperatures between minus 30 degrees and plus 50 degrees Celsius. This means, we can handle all areas which are relevant for us with one drive ”, says Schmid. The cooperation between both companies based on partner relationship during the duration of the entire project. “ We have very much appreciated the continuous and direct assistance of ABM Greiffenberger “, complimented by Stephan Schmid. “ Planning, testing, and optimisation have been performed at equal levels “. Since 2009, ABM has been delivering more than 60.000 SINOCHRON® motors to WITRON– and the show go on. Picture 1: Always close cooperation: Stephan Schmid, WITRON team leader for the development of control technology (left) and Wolfgang Wegmann, Sales Manager of industry applications at ABM Greiffenberger front of SINOCHRON® motor. Picture 2: The SINOCHRON® motors of ABM Greiffenberger are built the accumulating roller conveyer plants and operate completely maintenance-free. Picture 3: With only few manual movements, access to the electronics of the SINOCHRON® drive unit is possible. Picture 4: View of the assembly hall of WITRON, where the accumulating roller conveyer plants are created different designs. Picture 5: Access area and adjacent production hall pavilion-style Parkstein. WITRON attached importance to construction that adapts itself to the landscape. Pictures: ABM Greiffenberger Antriebstechnik GmbH

Geared Motors ABM Greiffenberger geared motors are available with standard helical- or parallel shaft gearboxes. Aside custom special gearboxes can be designed. Electronic Control Technology Increasingly automatic solutions must become more flexible and productive many fields. Moreover, you have the right to revoke the authorisation to use your data at any time with effect on the future.
